response: "I feel like I'm constantly under a microscope, expected to be flawless in every aspect of my life."
"It's overwhelming trying to live up to society's impossible standards of beauty and success."
"I'm starting to lose sight of who I really am because I'm so focused on being perfect for everyone else."
"I can't keep up with the pressure to always look a certain way and achieve certain goals."
"I feel like I'm drowning in expectations, and I don't know how to break free from them."
"I'm exhausted from pretending to have it all together when inside I'm falling apart."
"I'm starting to question my worth and value based on how well I conform to society's idea of perfection."
"I'm trapped in a cycle of comparison and self-doubt, constantly wondering if I'm good enough."
"I'm beginning to realize that the image of perfection I'm striving for is unattainable and damaging to my mental health."
"I need to find a way to redefine success and beauty on my own terms, or else I fear I'll lose myself completely."
